What Does it Mean to Be a Strong Woman? With Sarah Stonestreet and Erin Kunkle Part 1

What does it mean to be a strong woman? What messages should we be sending our daughters about what it looks like to be full of “grace and grit” in the culture right now? Sarah Stonestreet and Erin Kunkle, hosts of the “Strong Women Podcast” join me today to talk about their experience and what they hope to pass on to their own daughters.

Parenting a Rebellious Teens with Ginger Hubbard Part 2

Are you struggling to parent a rebellious teen? You’re not alone. Today’s guest has a powerful story of her own rebellion and how her parents, new Christians themselves, trusted and obeyed God in the midst of it all. Follow God, mom and dad! Good things are coming!

Questions from Listeners

It’s been a year since our government locked us down—and today’s questions reflect both the sorrow and frustration many are still experiencing. Bottom line: we need to be IN community and we need to use common sense if we’re going to keep moving forward. Today I’m taking questions from listeners. Be encouraged! You’re not alone.

Tell the Truth: The Emperor Has No Clothes

We are living in a time where it seems people are content to pretend that the radical agendas being pushed on the people is normal. It’s not. Time to start having conversations that are rooted in reality and based on truth. Time to take a stand! I’ll also be taking your questions today: A mother asks how to raise Christian kids even though her husband is not a Christian, Jennifer wants a new “Moral Majority,” back, a mom wonders how she can teach her high schoolers about the founding of the United States and another listener asks a great question about homeschooling.

Off the Bench for Parental Rights with Suzanne Gallagher

Everyone seems to have personal rights today, everyone that is except parents—but the truth is that Parents have more rights than they realize! It’s time for parents to learn about their rights, raise their voices and protect their children! Suzanne Gallagher, Executive Director of Parents Rights in Education is my guest.
